docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs
docs.text: For full documentation visit mkdocs.org.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Before You Begin
docs.text:
If you are creating a new lookup you will need to request that a table be created for you.

If you want to see how to query the BRE from a flow, fill in the in form below then click here

If you are updating the data on your table skip to the update data section

docs.title: Fill in the form with the necessary details and click "Update Directions"
docs.text: Select your data center: US1 EU1 EU2 ANZ1 CA1 JP1 SG1 Lookup Table Name: Label Name (keep default unless you have a reason): Key to be used in flows: Value or the variable used to pass the value to be looked up from your flow  (if you are using a variable remember to encapsulate it in double curly braces): Name of the variable you want the data returned to in your flow: Update Directions

docs.title: Preparing the tenant to use the BRE:
docs.text: ⚠️ Important note: All BRE are settings, rules, attributes, and labels are case sensitive!

docs.title: Navigate to the Business Rules
docs.text:
If you are a full admin on the Org you can cross launch or navigate directly to: Select your data center

If you are an external admin you must cross launch from the portal.

How to cross launch to BRE Rules

The steps in this section only need to be completed once on your tenant

Click Attributes in the top ribbon

Click Add

Name: context (case sensitive)

Data Type: Text

Click Save

Click Labels in the top ribbon

Click Add

Name: routeInfo (case sensitive)

Click Save

The steps in this section need to be completed for all new lookups on your tenant

Click Context in the top ribbon

Click Add Context

Name: Table/Context which was created for you (case sensitive)

Attribute: context

Click Save

Click on the line of the Context you just created ()

Add the rules listed below

docs.title: Create the "Found" rule
docs.text:
Click on Add Rule (Editor)

Name: Found

Active: True

Label: routeInfo

Priority: 100

Copy the rule into the editor:

when c: Contact() eval(c.getGlobalValuesManager().getAsString( c.getTenantId(), c.getAttribute("context") + "." + c.getAttribute("ani")) != null) then c.putAttribute("routeInfo", c.getGlobalValuesManager().getAsString(c.getTenantId(), c.getAttribute("context") + "." + c.getAttribute("ani"))); end

when c: Contact() eval(c.getGlobalValuesManager().getAsString( c.getTenantId(), c.getAttribute("context") + "." + c.getAttribute("ani")) != null) then c.putAttribute("routeInfo", c.getGlobalValuesManager().getAsString(c.getTenantId(), c.getAttribute("context") + "." + c.getAttribute("ani"))); end

docs.title: Create the "NotFound" rule
docs.text:
Click on Add Rule (Editor)

Name: Notfound

Active: True

Label: routeInfo

Priority: 99

Copy the rule into the editor:

when c: Contact() eval(c.getGlobalValuesManager().getAsString( c.getTenantId(), c.getAttribute("context") + "." + c.getAttribute("ani")) == null) then c.putAttribute("routeInfo", "NotFound"); end

when c: Contact() eval(c.getGlobalValuesManager().getAsString( c.getTenantId(), c.getAttribute("context") + "." + c.getAttribute("ani")) == null) then c.putAttribute("routeInfo", "NotFound"); end

docs.title: Adding, updating, and removing data from your BRE table
docs.text: Select your data center: US1 EU1 EU2 ANZ1 CA1 JP1 SG1

docs.title: Logging in
docs.text:
Navigate to Select your data center

Click the cluster to login

docs.title: Adding and updating data
docs.text:
Click Add BRE Data

Select your tenant name from the Tenant Name drop down

Select the table name you want to add/update data to in the BRE Lookup Type drop down

Add the value you will be looking up in the Key field

Add the value you want to be returned in the Value field

Clicking Add Data will let you add additional rows

Clicking the Remove button will remove the row from your Add/Update

⚠️ Note this will not delete entries from the BRE. If you need to delete entries, you must use the CSV method in the next section.

Click Submit to save the updates

docs.title: Adding, updating, and removing data in bulk
docs.text:
Create a CSV file with 3 columns

⚠️ CSV must have headers in the file or the first row will be skipped

Key: the value you will be looking up

Value: the value you want to be returned

Action: the action you want taken on the key (ADD, UPDATE, DELETE)

Example

Click Upload BRE CSV data

Select your tenant name from the Tenant Name drop down

Select the table name you want to add/update data to in the BRE Lookup Type drop down

Browse to select your CSV

Click Upload

docs.title: Accessing the BRE data from your flow
docs.text: table ani your lookup value

docs.title: Parsing BRE data to a variable
docs.text: YourOutputVariable $.routeInfo

docs.title: Pebble Templates Cheat Sheet
docs.text: These examples were created using the documentation available on the Pebble Templates site.

docs.title: Time
docs.text:
Return the current date and time in UTC (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS'Z)

{{now()}}

Return the current time in a different time zone

{{now() | date("HHmm", existingFormat="yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss", timeZone="America/New_York")}}

Return the current time as hours only in a different time zone

{{now() | date("HH", existingFormat="yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss", timeZone="America/New_York")}}

Return the day of the week from the current time

{{now() | date("EEEE", existingFormat="yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS'Z'") }}

Return the current time as Epoch in seconds

{{now() | epoch}}

Return the current time as Epoch in milliseconds

{{now() | epoch(inMillis=true)}}

Calculate the number of seconds a call has been in queue after capturing the current time as Epoch in seconds after placing the call in the queue

{{now() | epoch - capturedTime }}

Convert milliseconds to whole minutes rounding up if the time is 30 seconds or more into the next minute. (90 seconds will return 2 minutes)

{{ EWT/60000 + (( EWT % 60000)/1000 >= 30 ? 1 : 0 ) }}

docs.title: Strings
docs.text:
Return the last 10 characters of an ANI

{{NewPhoneContact.ANI | slice (NewPhoneContact.ANI.length -10,NewPhoneContact.ANI.length)}}

Return the last 10 characters of an DNIS

{{NewPhoneContact.DNIS | slice (NewPhoneContact.DNIS.length -10,NewPhoneContact.DNIS.length)}}

Return the last 4 characters of an ANI

{{NewPhoneContact.ANI|slice(NewPhoneContact-4,NewPhoneContact.ANI.length)}}

Split a comma delimited string into addressable pieces. (Replace "string" with the name of the string you need to split and "number" will be an Integer variable representing which value you want to return (starting with 1))

{{string|split(",",string|split(",")|length-(string|split(",")|length-number))|last|split(",")|first}}

Or

{{string|split(",")|slice(number-1,number)|first}}

Or With the addressable range starting at 0

{{(string|split(","))[number]}}

docs.title: Numbers, Logic, and Comparison
docs.text:
Increment a counter

{{counter + 1}}

Test if a number is Even (returns true/false)

{{counter is even}}

Test if a number is Odd (returns true/false)

{{counter is odd}}

Test if a variable exists in an array or list.

{{["410", "443", "667"] contains Caller_Area}}

Test if two conditions are true (set int to 1 and string to Bill)

{{int is odd and string|lower == "bill"}}

Test if one of two or more conditions are true (set int to 1 and string to Steve)

{{(int is odd) or (string|lower == "bill")}}

Test if an expression is not true

{{3 is not even}}

Test if a given time stamp (as a string formatted yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS'Z') is less that or equal to 24 hours old

{{( dateToCheck | epoch) <= (now() | epoch - 86400)}}
